title: Enhancing Patient Care Practical Competencies: Computer-Based Mathematics Applying Merrill’s Instructional Interaction Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic grasp of mathematical concepts and experience using online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Design math education modules using Merill’s five types of instructional interactions (activation, demonstration, application, confirmation, integration) based on his Instructional Interaction Theory
Produce reusable educational content using XML-based open standard formats
Develop customized educational materials for various math topics by applying modular component structures

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
